content: What ancient Greek philosopher's work 'The Republic' presents his vision of an ideal society?

The ancient Greek philosopher whose work "The Republic" presents his vision of an ideal society is Plato. In this seminal work, Plato, through the character of Socrates, outlines his ideas on justice, governance, and the ideal state, often referred to as the "Kallipolis." The Republic is not only a treatise on political philosophy but also delves into ethics, metaphysics, and epistemology, making it one of the most influential works in Western philosophy.
